line.words: Il Grande Mostro Pipistrello Da Dave Waddell

subtitle.line: Det store flagermuseuhyreAf Dave Waddell
Het Grote Vleermuis MonsterDoor Dave Waddell
The Great Bat MonsterBy Dave Waddell
The Great Bat MonsterBy Dave Waddell

line.words: La fiera è arrivata alla città di Alfredo.

subtitle.line: Der er kommet tivoli til Alfredos by.
Het is kermis in Alfreds stad.
The fair has come to Alfredo’s town.
The fair has come to Alfredo’s town.

line.words: Alfredo sta sognando della fiera. Nel suo sogno c’era una monorotaia. Ha preso tutti dove volevano andare.

subtitle.line: Alfredo har drømt om det tivoli. I hans drøm var der en monorail. Den kørte alle hen, hvor de ville.
Alfred heeft al over de kermis gedroomd. In zijn droom was er een treintje. Die bracht iedereen waar ze naartoe wilden.
Alfredo has been dreaming of the fair. In his dream there was a monorail. It took everyone where they wanted to go.
Alfredo has been dreaming of the fair. In his dream there was a monorail. It took everyone where they wanted to go.

line.words: C’erano pagliacci, una ruota panoramica, un carosello, autoscontri, un ottovolante e molte altre cose che si associa con una fiera. Nel suo sogno Alfredo è andato nel tunnel degli orrori. È stato il migiliore.

subtitle.line: Der var klovne, et pariserhjul, en karrusel, små rutschebaner, en rutschebane, radiobiler og en masse andre sjove ting. I drømmen fik Alfredo en tur i spøgelsestoget. Det var det bedste.
Er waren clowns, een reuzenrad, een draaimolen, glijbanen, botsauto’s, een achtbaan en nog veel meer. In zijn droom ging Alfred in het spookhuis. Het was geweldig.
There were clowns, a Big Wheel, a merry-go-round, slides, rides, bumper cars, a roller coaster and lots of other fair things. In his dream Alfredo went on the ghost train. It was the best.
There were clowns, a Big Wheel, a merry-go-round, slides, rides, bumper cars, a roller coaster and lots of other fair things. In his dream Alfredo went on the ghost train. It was the best.

line.words: Alfredo è più eccitato che un porco che gioca nel fango.

subtitle.line: Alfredo er mere spændt end en gris i mudderet.
Alfred is zo blij als een kind.
Alfredo is more excited than a pig in mud.
Alfredo is more excited than a pig in mud.

line.words: Alfredo e la mamma di Alfredo vanno alla fiera. “Non vedo l’ora” dice Alfredo. “Neanch’io” dice la mamma di Alfredo.

subtitle.line: Alfredo og Alfredos mor tager i tivoli.”Jeg kan næsten ikke vente”, siger Alfredo.”Det kan jeg heller ikke”, siger Alfredos mor.
Alfred en zijn moeder gaan naar de kermis.“Ik kan niet wachten,” zegt Alfred.“Ik ook niet,” zegt Alfreds moeder.
Alfredo and Alfredo’s Mum go to the fair.“I can’t wait,” says Alfredo. “Neither can I,” says Alfredo’s Mum.
Alfredo and Alfredo’s Mum go to the fair.“I can’t wait,” says Alfredo. “Neither can I,” says Alfredo’s Mum.

line.words: “Vado nel tunnel degli orrori” dice Alfredo. “Anch’io” dice la mamma di Alfredo.

subtitle.line: “Jeg skal have en tur i spøgelsestoget”, siger Alfredo.”Det skal jeg også”, siger Alfredos mor.
‘‘Ik ga naar het spookhuis,” zegt Alfred.“Ik ook,” zegt Alfreds moeder.
‘‘I’m going to go on the ghost train,” says Alfredo.“Me too,” says Alfredo’s Mum.
‘‘I’m going to go on the ghost train,” says Alfredo.“Me too,” says Alfredo’s Mum.

line.words: “Scommetto che c’è uno scheletro” dice Alfredo.

subtitle.line: “Der er garanteret et skelet”, siger Alfredo.
“Er is vast een skelet,’ zegt Alfred.
“I bet there’s a skeleton,’ says Alfredo.
“I bet there’s a skeleton,’ says Alfredo.

line.words: “È un gufo” dice la mamma di Alfredo. “È un lupo e porte che sbattono e catene, ratti e ragni. Quando ero piccola sono andata nel tunnel degli orrori. Ho visto il Grande Mostro Pipistrello. L’ho sentito sussurrando cattive parole.”

subtitle.line: ”Og en ugle”, siger Alfredos mor. ”Og en ulv, døre, der smækker i og kæder, rotter og edderkopper. Da jeg var lille, var jeg i spøgelsestoget. Der så jeg det store flagermuseuhyre. Jeg hørte det hviske onde ord.”

“En een uil,” zegt Alfreds moeder. “En een wolf, en dichtslaande deuren, en kettingen, ratten en spinnen. Toen ik klein was ben ik ook in een spookhuis geweest. Ik zag het Grote Vleermuis Monster. Ik hoorde hem nare woorden fluisteren.”

“And an owl,” says Alfredo’s Mum. “And a wolf, and slamming doors, and chains, rats and spiders. When I was little, I went on a ghost train. I saw the Great Bat Monster. I heard it whisper evil words. ”

“And an owl,” says Alfredo’s Mum. “And a wolf, and slamming doors, and chains, rats and spiders. When I was little, I went on a ghost train. I saw the Great Bat Monster. I heard it whisper evil words. ”

line.words: Questo fa arrabbiare Alfredo. “Non hai sentito niente” dice. “Non hai visto il Grande Mostro Pipistrello. Non c’era quando eri piccola.”

subtitle.line: Det irriterer Alfredo.”Nej, du gjorde ej”, siger han. ”Du så ikke det store flagermuseuhyre. Det fandtes ikke, da du var lille”.
Dit irriteert Alfred. “Echt niet,” zegt hij. “Je zag geen Groot Vleermuis Monster. Die was er nog niet toen jij klein was.”
This annoys Alfredo. “You did not,” he says. “You did not see the Great Bat Monster. It was not around when you were little.’
This annoys Alfredo. “You did not,” he says. “You did not see the Great Bat Monster. It was not around when you were little.’

line.words: “Si, c’era. Chiede a zia Pat. Avevo dieci anni. Aveva l’età minima. Aveva nove anni. Siamo andate insieme.” “Non è vero” dice Alfredo. Il sangue bolle.

subtitle.line: ”Jo det gjorde. Spørg tante Pat. Jeg var ti år. Hun var lige gammel nok, 9 år. Vi kørte sammen.””Det passer ikke”, siger Alfredo. Hans blod koger.
“Jawel. Vraag het maar aan tante Patty. Ik was 10 jaar. Zij mocht er pas net in. Ze was 9. We gingen samen.”“Niet waar,” zegt Alfred. Zijn bloed kookt.
‘It was. Ask Auntie Pat. I was 10 years old. She was the minimum age. She was 9. We went together.”“Not true,” says Alfredo. His blood is boiling.
‘It was. Ask Auntie Pat. I was 10 years old. She was the minimum age. She was 9. We went together.”“Not true,” says Alfredo. His blood is boiling.

line.words: “È vero” dice la mamma di Alfredo. “Ho ancora il biglietto. Un biglietto costava cinquanta pence. Allora abbiamo misurato poco più di un metro – l’altezza minima. C’è stata un’altezza minima a quel tempo.”

subtitle.line: “Jo det gør”, siger Alfredos mor. Jeg har stadig billetten. En billet kostede 50 pence. Vi var kun lige over en meter, som var mindstehøjden. Der var mindstehøjde den gang.”

“Wel waar,” zegt Alfreds moeder. “Ik heb het kaartje nog steeds. Een kaartje kostte 50 cent. We waren ook maar net groot genoeg – net meer dan een meter. Toen moest je nog een bepaalde lengte hebben.”
“It is,” says Alfredo’s Mum. “I still have the ticket. One ticket cost 50 pence. Also, we were just over one metre tall - the minimum height. There was a minimum height in those days.”
“It is,” says Alfredo’s Mum. “I still have the ticket. One ticket cost 50 pence. Also, we were just over one metre tall - the minimum height. There was a minimum height in those days.”

line.words: “Non c’era” dice Alfredo, “e nemmeno il Grande Mostro Pipistrello non c’era.”

subtitle.line: ”Vel var der ej”, siger Alfredo, ”og det store flagermuseuhyre fandtes heller ikke”.
“Echt niet,” zegt Alfred, “en het Grote Vleermuis Monster bestond ook niet.”
“There was not,” says Alfredo, “and the Great Bat Monster was not either.”
“There was not,” says Alfredo, “and the Great Bat Monster was not either.”

line.words: Alfredo e la mamma di Alfredo si sono fermati parlare. Sono quasi li alla fiera. Questa visita non ha nessuna somiglianza al suo sogno.

subtitle.line: Alfredo og Alfredos mor siger ikke mere. De er næsten henne ved tivoli. Det er slet ikke som i Alfredos drøm.
Alfred en zijn moeder stoppen met praten. Ze zijn bijna bij de kermis. Het is helemaal niet zoals in Alfreds droom.
Alfredo and Alfredo’s Mum stop talking to each other. They are nearly at the fair. This visit to the fair is nothing like Alfredo’s dream.
Alfredo and Alfredo’s Mum stop talking to each other. They are nearly at the fair. This visit to the fair is nothing like Alfredo’s dream.

line.words: Quando arrivano alla fiera, non c’è. È solo un campo. Una vecchia si sede per terra. “Scusami” dice la mamma di Alfredo, “ma dov’è la fiera?” “La fiera?” dice la vecchia. “La fiera c’è stata la settimana scorsa, tesora.”

subtitle.line: Da de når hen til tivoliet, er det der slet ikke. Der er bare en mark. Der sidder en gammel dame på græsset.”Undskyld”, siger Alfredos mor, ”men hvor er tivoliet?””Tivoliet?”, siger den gamle dame. ”Det var da i sidste uge”.

Wanneer ze bij de kermis komen, is er niks. Het is een leeg veld. Een oude vrouw zit in het gras.“Pardon,” zegt Alfreds moeder, “waar is de kermis?”“Kermis?” vraagt de oude vrouw. “De kermis was hier vorige week.”

When they get to the fair, it is not there. It is just a field. An old woman is sitting on the grass. “Excuse me,” says Alfredo’s Mum, ‘but where is the fair?”“Fair?” says the old woman. “The fair was last week, my dear.”

When they get to the fair, it is not there. It is just a field. An old woman is sitting on the grass. “Excuse me,” says Alfredo’s Mum, ‘but where is the fair?”“Fair?” says the old woman. “The fair was last week, my dear.”

line.words: “Aveva un tunnel degli orrori?” dice Alfredo. “Si, tesoro” dice la vecchia. “Ma non c’era il Grande Mostro Pipistrello. Amo il Grande Mostro Pipistrello. Mi ricordo quando ero piccola…”

subtitle.line: ”Var der et spøgelsestog?” siger Alfredo.”Ja”, siger den gamle dame. Men det store flagermuseuhyre var der ikke. Jeg elsker det store flagermuseuhyre. Jeg kan huske, da jeg var lille…”
“Was er een spookhuis?” vraagt Alfred.“Ja, lieverd,” zegt de oude vrouw. “Maar geen Groot Vleermuis Monster. Ik ben gek op het Grote Vleermuis Monster. Ik weet nog goed, toen ik vroeger…”
“Did it have a ghost train?” says Alfredo.“Yes, dear,” says the old lady. “But no Great Bat Monster. I love the Great Bat Monster. I remember when I was little…”
“Did it have a ghost train?” says Alfredo.“Yes, dear,” says the old lady. “But no Great Bat Monster. I love the Great Bat Monster. I remember when I was little…”

line.words: La vecchia parla dei Grandi mostri Pipistrelli quando era giovane.

subtitle.line: Den gamle dame siger noget mere om det store flagermuseuhyre fra den gang, hun var barn.
De oude vrouw praat over het Grote Vleermuis Monster van toen ze klein was.
The old lady talks about some of the Great Bat Monsters of her youth.
The old lady talks about some of the Great Bat Monsters of her youth.

line.words: La mamma di Alfredo non dice niente.

subtitle.line: Alfredos mor siger ikke noget.
Alfreds moeder zegt niets.
Alfredo’s Mum does not say anything.
Alfredo’s Mum does not say anything.

line.words: Alfredo non dice niente.

subtitle.line: Alfredo siger ikke noget.
Alfred zegt niets.
Alfredo does not say anything.
Alfredo does not say anything.

line.words: La vecchia si ferma parlare. Se ne va. Alfredo e la mamma di Alfredo si sedono per terra. “Mamma?” dice Alfredo. “Si?” dice la mamma di Alfredo. “Quando sei andata alla fiera con zia Pat…”

subtitle.line: Den gamle dame er færdig med sin fortælling. Hun går. Alfredo og Alfredos mor sætter sig i græsset.”Mor?” siger Alfredo.”Ja?” siger Alfredos mor.”Kan du huske, da du var i tivoli med tante Pat?”
De oude vrouw is uitgepraat. Ze gaat weg. Afred en zijn moeder zitten in het gras.“Mam?” zegt Alfred.“Ja?” zegt Alfreds moeder.“Weet je nog dat je naar de kermis ging met tante Patty?”
The old woman finishes talking. She goes. Alfredo and Alfredo’s Mum sit on the grass.“Mum?” says Alfredo.“Yes?” says Alfredo’s Mum.“You know when you went to the fair with Auntie Pat?”
The old woman finishes talking. She goes. Alfredo and Alfredo’s Mum sit on the grass.“Mum?” says Alfredo.“Yes?” says Alfredo’s Mum.“You know when you went to the fair with Auntie Pat?”

line.words: “Si” dice la mamma di Alfredo. “E hai visto il Grande Mostro Pipistrello?” “Si?” dice ma mamma di Alfredo. “Come sembrava?”

subtitle.line: ”Ja?” siger Alfredos mor.”Og du så det store flagermuseuhyre?””Ja?” siger Alfredos mor.”Hvordan så det ud?”
“Ja?” zegt Alfreds moeder.“En dat je het Grote Vleermuis Monster zag?”“Ja?” zegt Alfreds moeder.“Hoe zag het eruit?”
“Yes?” says Alfredo’s Mum.“And you saw the Great Bat Monster?”“Yes?” says Alfredo’s Mum.“What did it look like?”
“Yes?” says Alfredo’s Mum.“And you saw the Great Bat Monster?”“Yes?” says Alfredo’s Mum.“What did it look like?”

line.words: “Allora” dice la mamma di Alfredo, e racconta la storia del più Grande Mostro Pipistrello che ha mai vissuto.

subtitle.line: ”Tja”, siger Alfredos mor og fortæller Alfredo alt om det store flagermuseuhyre.
“Nou,” zegt Alfreds moeder, en ze vertelt Alfred over het meest fantastische Grote Vleermuis Monster dat ooit heeft bestaan.
“Well,” says Alfredo’s Mum, and tells Alfredo all about the greatest Great Bat Monster that ever lived.
“Well,” says Alfredo’s Mum, and tells Alfredo all about the greatest Great Bat Monster that ever lived.
The end.
The end.
